title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.73 - Executive Order No. 73: Reestablishing the New York State Economic Development Board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.73 - Executive Order No. 73: Reestablishing the New York State Economic Development Board

State Regulations
I, Hugh L. Carey, by virtue of the authority vested in me
by the Constitution and the laws of the State of New York, and as Governor of
the State of New York, by Executive Order do hereby reestablish in the

Executive Department a board to be known as the New York State Economic

Development Board, to act as a cabinet-level economic development advisory
group, representative of both management and labor in the private
sector. General Powers and Duties

It is the policy of the State in meeting public needs to
establish economic programs, policies, and priorities to achieve sound and
balanced economic growth and development, the reduction of chronic unemployment
and the establishment of permanent jobs in the private sector. To assist in carrying out the foregoing policy, the New

York State Economic Development Board shall: - Study and from time to time report to the Governor on
existing and potential economic developments, programs, projects and trends in
the State; - Provide a forum for the development of consensus among
management and labor to guide the Governor and his cabinet members; - Undertake economic and fiscal studies which the Governor
deems appropriate and desirable; - Based on these studies, formulate and recommend to the

Governor courses of action consistent with sound and balanced state economic
development; - Assist the Governor in the advocacy of those State
programs aimed at economic development. Membership

The New York State Economic Development Board shall consist
of such members as may be appointed by the Governor. Such membership shall be
selected from the private business and labor communities of this State. The

Governor shall designate a chairman and two vice-chairmen. Rescission of Prior Orders, Effective Date and

Transfer Provisions

Executive Order Number 7 dated March 19, 1975, as amended
by Executive Order Number 7.1 dated August 25, 1975 and Executive Order Number
7.2 dated February 3, 1976, creating the New York State Economic Development

Board, is hereby rescinded effective immediately, On such date, all the
functions, powers, duties and obligations possessed by the New York State

Economic Development Board created under such Order relating to its duties to
oversee and coordinate economic development planning and research activities in
the State and to act as the State's economic planning agency pursuant to Public

Law
89-136
(Public Works and Economic Development Act of 1965, as amended), and
all duties incidental thereto, shall be transferred and assigned to, assumed by
and devolved upon the New York State Department of Commerce; and all rights and
obligations of the New York State Economic Development Board under any contract
or agreement relating to such functions, powers, duties, and obligations to
which the New York State Economic Development Board is a party, are hereby
transferred and assigned to, devolved upon and assumed by the New York State

Department of Commerce. With respect to the functions, powers, duties and
obligations so transferred and assumed, the New York State Department of

Commerce shall be deemed and be held to constitute the continuation of the New

York State Economic Development Board for those purposes and not a different
board, agency or authority. Any proceeding or other business or matter
heretofore undertaken or commenced by or before the New York State Economic

Development Board relative to the functions, powers, duties and obligations
herein transferred and assumed by the New York State Department of Commerce may
be conducted and completed by the New York State Department of Commerce in the
same manner and under the same conditions and with the same effect as if
conducted and completed by the New York State Economic Development

Board. With respect to the functions, powers, duties and
obligations retained in the New York State Economic Development Board
reestablished by this Executive Order, the New York State Economic Development

Board shall be deemed and be held to constitute the continuation of such former

Board and not a different board, agency or authority. Any proceeding or other
business or matter heretofore undertaken or commenced by or before such former

New York State Economic Development Board relating to such functions, powers, duties and obligations retained pursuant to this Executive Order may be
conducted and completed by the New York State Economic Development Board
reestablished by this Executive Order in the same manner and under the same
conditions and with the same effect as if conducted and completed by such Board
as created pursuant to the Executive Order, as amended, hereinabove referred
to. The members and officers of the New York State Economic

Development Board appointed by the Governor pursuant to the Executive Order, as
amended, herein rescinded who are in office on the date of this Executive Order
shall continue to be members and officers respectively of the New York State

Economic Development Board reestablished by this Executive Order without the
necessity of reappointment. All federal funds available to the New York State Economic

Development Board for the performance of the functions, powers, duties and
obligations transferred and assigned to the New York State Department of

Commerce pursuant to this Executive Order, to the extent remaining unexpended
or unencumbered, shall be transferred to and made available for use by the New

York State Department of Commerce for the same purposes for which originally
provided. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: July 12, 1978

Notes

3.73

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
